intro: Linosyris corymbuligera, commonly known as the clustered linseed plant, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Pedaliaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, branched stems that bear small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linosyris corymbuligera is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
